title: How to Burn MP3 to CD

steps.title: Launch iTunes and click on “File.
steps.content: Launch iTunes and click on “File. ”

steps.title: Click on “New” and select “Playlist.
steps.content: Click on “New” and select “Playlist. ”

steps.title: Type a name for the playlist, then drag and drop songs from your iTunes library into the playlist window on the right.
steps.content: Type a name for the playlist, then drag and drop songs from your iTunes library into the playlist window on the right. You must have a playlist created before you can burn songs to CD.

steps.title: Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer.
steps.content: Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select your playlist and click on “File.
steps.content: Select your playlist and click on “File. ” [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select “Burn Playlist to Disc,” then select either “Audio CD” or “MP3 CD” as the disc format, based on your preference.
steps.content: Select “Burn Playlist to Disc,” then select either “Audio CD” or “MP3 CD” as the disc format, based on your preference. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click on “Burn.
steps.content: Click on “Burn. ” The process will take up to several minutes to complete, and iTunes will notify you when burning is complete. If your playlist is too large to fit on disc, iTunes will prompt you to insert another disc to finish the burning process. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Launch Windows Media Player and click on the “Burn” tab.
steps.content: Launch Windows Media Player and click on the “Burn” tab. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Drag and drop songs and playlists into the burn list on the right.
steps.content: Drag and drop songs and playlists into the burn list on the right. The songs must be added to the burn list in the order in which you want them listed on the CD.

steps.title: Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer.
steps.content: Insert a blank CD-R disc into the optical disc drive in your computer. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the burn tab at the top right corner.
steps.content: Click on the burn tab at the top right corner. The icon resembles a piece of paper with a green checkmark. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select “Audio CD,” then click on “Start Burn.
steps.content: Select “Audio CD,” then click on “Start Burn. ” The process will take up to several minutes, and Windows Media Player will eject the CD when burning is complete.

steps.title: Launch RealPlayer and click on the “Burn” tab.
steps.content: Launch RealPlayer and click on the “Burn” tab.

steps.title: Select “Audio CD Burner,” then insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer.
steps.content: Select “Audio CD Burner,” then insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer.

steps.title: Click on “Burn” at the top of RealPlayer.
steps.content: Click on “Burn” at the top of RealPlayer.

steps.title: Click on “Select CD Type” under Tasks in the right sidebar.
steps.content: Click on “Select CD Type” under Tasks in the right sidebar.

steps.title: Select “Audio CD” or “MP3 CD,” then click on “OK.
steps.content: Select “Audio CD” or “MP3 CD,” then click on “OK. ”

steps.title: Click on “Add Tracks from my Library,” then select “All Music.
steps.content: Click on “Add Tracks from my Library,” then select “All Music. ”

steps.title: Drag and drop tracks from the left into the burn list on the right.
steps.content: Drag and drop tracks from the left into the burn list on the right. RealPlayer will keep you updated as to how much space is remaining on the disc as you move tracks to the burn list. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click on “Burn Your CD.
steps.content: Click on “Burn Your CD. ” The process will take up to several minutes to complete, and notify you when the CD has been burned successfully. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Launch Winamp and insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer.
steps.content: Launch Winamp and insert a blank CD-R into the disc drive in your computer.

steps.title: Click on “View” and select “Media Library.
steps.content: Click on “View” and select “Media Library. ”

steps.title: Select “Blank Disk” from the list under Media Library, then click on “Add” at the bottom of the Winamp window.
steps.content: Select “Blank Disk” from the list under Media Library, then click on “Add” at the bottom of the Winamp window.

steps.title: Select the playlist you want burned, or click on “Files” or “Folders” to search for music.
steps.content: Select the playlist you want burned, or click on “Files” or “Folders” to search for music.

steps.title: Select the tracks you want burned to CD, then click on “OK.
steps.content: Select the tracks you want burned to CD, then click on “OK. ”

steps.title: Click on “Burn” at the bottom of Winamp, then select “Enable Burn-proof mode.
steps.content: Click on “Burn” at the bottom of Winamp, then select “Enable Burn-proof mode. ” [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click on “Burn” in the Burn dialog box.
steps.content: Click on “Burn” in the Burn dialog box. The process will take up to several minutes to complete, and Winamp will notify you when the CD has been burned successfully. [11] X Research source
